name: Spaghetti with Lentil Bolognese
description: Spaghetti with Lentil Bolognese - Vegan, hearty, delicious, and packed with protein and iron! Perfect for Italian pasta nights!
recipeIngredient: 1  large carrot, cut into small pieces
2 stalks of celery, cut into small pieces
1/3 cup dry red wine (use a vegan brand)
1 teaspoon soy sauce ((optional, leave it out for a soy-free version))

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the spaghetti according to the instructions on the package. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the spaghetti according to the instructions on the package. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large sauce pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion for about 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook it for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large sauce pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion for about 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook it for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the carrots and celery and cook for a further 3 minutes. Then stir in the red lentils and the tomato paste. After another minute, deglaze with red wine and allow to evaporate (this will take about 1 minute).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the carrots and celery and cook for a further 3 minutes. Then stir in the red lentils and the tomato paste. After another minute, deglaze with red wine and allow to evaporate (this will take about 1 minute).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth and simmer for about 15-20 minutes until the sauce is thick and the lentils are fairly soft and good to eat (they shouldn't be too soft).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth and simmer for about 15-20 minutes until the sauce is thick and the lentils are fairly soft and good to eat (they shouldn't be too soft).

recipeInstructions.text: Season with the Italian spices, salt, and pepper and - if using - soy sauce. Serve together with the spaghetti and sprinkle with some fresh basil leaves.
